skill.name: firebase-development-add-feature
skill.description: This skill should be used when adding features to existing Firebase projects. Triggers on "add function", "create endpoint", "new tool", "add api", "new collection", "implement", "build feature". Guides TDD workflow with test-first development, security rules, and emulator verification.
skill.summary: Add new features to Firebase projects using test-driven development workflow
skill.author: 2389-research

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation-only guidance file for Firebase development workflows. All static findings are false positives from code examples in markdown. The skill contains TypeScript and bash code snippets as educational examples, not executable code. No actual security risks detected.

content.user_title: Build Firebase Features with Test-Driven Development
content.value_statement: Adding new features to Firebase projects requires careful planning and testing. This skill guides developers through a structured workflow for adding Cloud Functions, Firestore collections, and API endpoints using test-driven development practices.
actual_capabilities: Guide developers through 12-step workflow for adding Firebase features
Provide code templates for Cloud Functions, Firestore rules, and authentication
Enforce test-first development with unit and integration test examples
Generate consistent response patterns for API endpoints
Create Firestore security rules for server-write and client-write scenarios
limitations: Requires existing Firebase project setup, does not create new projects
Focused on JavaScript and TypeScript Firebase development only
Does not handle deployment configuration or CI/CD pipelines
Assumes familiarity with Firebase architecture and concepts

use_cases.title: Add HTTP API Endpoint
use_cases.description: Create a new REST API endpoint with authentication, validation, and testing for your Firebase Cloud Functions project.

use_cases.title: Create Firestore Collection with Rules
use_cases.description: Set up a new Firestore collection with proper security rules, indexes, and integration tests to ensure data access control.

use_cases.title: Implement Callable Function
use_cases.description: Build a Firebase callable function that client SDKs can invoke with built-in authentication and structured error handling.
use_cases.target_user: Mobile and web developers integrating backend logic

prompt_templates.title: Add Simple HTTP Endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new HTTP endpoint called getUserProfile that accepts a user ID and returns profile data from Firestore
prompt_templates.scenario: Basic API endpoint creation with Firestore read operation

prompt_templates.title: Create Collection with Security
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Firestore collection called notifications with server-write-only rules and an index on userId and createdAt
prompt_templates.scenario: Setting up secure Firestore collection with proper access control

prompt_templates.title: Build Authenticated Callable Function
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a callable function named updateUserSettings that validates authentication and updates user preferences in Firestore
prompt_templates.scenario: Client-callable function with authentication and data validation

prompt_templates.title: Add Scheduled Background Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a scheduled function that runs daily at midnight to clean up expired session tokens from the database
prompt_templates.scenario: Advanced cron-based Cloud Function with database operations

output_examples.input: Add an endpoint to create new todo items
output_examples.output: I will create a new Cloud Function endpoint for creating todo items. First, I will write tests, then implement the handler with validation, add Firestore security rules, and verify with emulators. The endpoint will follow the standard response pattern with success, message, and data fields.

output_examples.input: Set up a Firestore collection for user comments with proper security
output_examples.output: I will create the comments collection with security rules that allow authenticated users to create comments but only allow updates to their own comments. I will add an index for querying comments by postId and createdAt, then verify the rules in the Firebase emulator.

output_examples.input: Implement a callable function for processing payments
output_examples.output: I will create a callable function with authentication checks, input validation for payment data, integration with your payment service, proper error handling, and comprehensive tests including success cases and validation failures.

best_practices: Always write tests before implementation to ensure features work as expected
Use consistent response patterns with success, message, and optional data fields
Add security rules for every new Firestore collection to prevent unauthorized access
anti_patterns: Skipping emulator testing and deploying directly to production without verification
Writing implementation code before creating failing tests violates TDD principles
Omitting authentication checks or assuming all requests are from trusted sources

faq.question: Does this skill create new Firebase projects?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed for adding features to existing Firebase projects. For initial project setup, use the firebase-development:project-setup skill.

faq.question: What testing framework does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill provides examples using Vitest for unit tests and integration tests with Firebase emulators. You can adapt the patterns to other testing frameworks.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for Firebase Realtime Database?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on Firestore collections and Cloud Functions. The patterns can be adapted for Realtime Database but examples are Firestore-specific.

faq.question: How does authentication work in the generated code?
faq.answer: The skill supports both Firebase Authentication tokens and API key-based authentication. It provides templates for both patterns based on your project architecture.

faq.question: Will this skill deploy my functions automatically?
faq.answer: No, the skill guides you through development and emulator testing. You control when to deploy to production using firebase deploy commands.

faq.question: What is the standard response pattern mentioned?
faq.answer: All handlers return objects with success (boolean), message (string), and optional data fields to ensure consistent API responses across your application.
